snippet: The move to bar politics from the anniversary event comes amid reports of tension among the mayor’s office, the Port Authority and the memorial’s leadership.
abstract: National September 11 Memorial and Museum announces that elected officials are barred from speaking at this year's ceremony to commemorate the anniversary of the terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center; move to bar politics from the annual event comes amid reports of tension between the office of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, the memorial's chairman and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
lead_paragraph: The move to bar politics from the anniversary event comes amid reports of tension among the mayor’s office, the Port Authority and the memorial’s leadership.
